title: SQLADD CONSTRAINT Keyword

metadata.description: Learn about SQLADD CONSTRAINT Keyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Reference

❯
ADD CONSTRAINT
The
ADD CONSTRAINT
command is used to create 
a constraint after a table is already created.
The following SQL adds a constraint named "PK_Person" that is a 
PRIMARY KEY constraint on multiple columns (ID and LastName):
Example
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD CONSTRAINT PK_Person PRIMARY KEY (ID,LastName);

Reference

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD CONSTRAINT PK_Person PRIMARY KEY (ID,LastName);

options:
a

quiz.explanation:

summary: This tutorial covers SQLADD CONSTRAINT Keyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQLADD CONSTRAINT Keyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQLADD CONSTRAINT Keyword and how to apply it in your projects.
